channel.title: Ubuntu
channel.description:
I want to install Ubuntu and just run a 'dual' OS.
Anyone use Ubuntu and have feedback? I've never used Linux before and would appreciate some information or tips!

item.title: Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:

t4:

archbang pls

Is it good?
Its Arch with openbox and Awesome pre-installed, right?

item.title: Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“ollie123, post:44, topic:441359”]Not too much of an Ubuntu fan. Seems that it is going the way of Mac OS X, i.e. customisability is going down the drain. I prefer Debian or Arch.[/quote]I disagree. Customisation is coming up since the release of 12.04.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:40, topic:441359”][quote author=t4 link=topic=544050.msg3988712#msg3988712 date=1336275216]

Does anyone know of any Linux OSes (or any OS for this matter) that can run on a computer with 512MB of DDR RAM? I’ve tried ubuntu, but it really doesn’t work well with Ubuntu. It lags like a bitch and freezes to the point where I have to force-shut it down. I really don’t want to just throw away a computer, there’s nothing wrong with it

DOS

Lol
Any real ideas? It’s just going to be used for programming, not any kind of gaming whatsoever.

put debian on it with no WM, use vi and you’re set.
[/quote]

Arch Linux. You can do the same thing, and the updates are more frequent.[/quote]
and more likely to fuck you over if you’re not careful, and it can be a pain in the dick to fix if you’re not well versed with linux.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Jc22493:

Thanks for the input, guys! I installed it, gonna check it out some more now!

Hope you enjoy it. If you need any help getting used to it, there is an MSN client in the software center. You can add my msn:
soharuda@hotmail.com

I have it running on my Asus tablet right now while I do some drawing lol. Its as close as I can get to a drawing tablet.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

It’s wonderful! 12.04 also solved a lot of the issues people had with 11.04. I’ve never had any issues with graphics drivers. Ubuntu will automatically run the open source driver, but you can find proprietary drivers on the installer or somewhere online. Also with program support, you just need to look for alternatives.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote="_s, post:33, topic:441359"][quote author=`Alec link=topic=544050.msg3988031#msg3988031 date=1336190494]

also, Steam has been announced for Linux, which will hopefully boost its popularity.

that’s a lie.
[/quote]
keep up to date and fuck off when you aren’t

Engadget

Steam for Linux is coming, and after waiting epochs what's a few more months?

It's been a long-running saga as to when Linux users will finally see some native gaming action on Steam, but according to Phoronix that happy day will likely...


The Verge – 25 Apr 12

Valve is developing Steam for Linux, release 'not too far out' (updated with...

Linux gamers, perk up your ears: the elusive port of Valve Software's digital game distribution platform Steam is finally in development, according to a Phoronix scoop. After spending years trying...


http://www.techradar.com/news/gaming/valve-finally-looking-to-launch-steam-on-linux-1077605[/quote]
omfgdgogjdfogdjgfogmfo gmfogmfo gmfgofmg fogm O M F G

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:26, topic:441359”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=544050.msg3988196#msg3988196 date=1336222702]

Ubuntu is very lightweight and I only recommend it if you don’t do any gaming and/or if you have outdated hardware.
For other reasons, go with windows, some fags actually use Ubuntu so they look bad-ass programmers, makes me laugh every time I see one.

Ubuntu is no where near lightweight…

It is more lightweight than windows. Talking from experience and Ubuntu 9.04.
[/quote]

If you consider ubuntu lightweight then what is arch? Based on resource usage while idling, Win7 and Ubuntu 12.04 are almost identical. 9.04 is 3 years old now, and long before Unity came around, I think its time you upgrade.[/quote]
Did I ever say that I’m using Ubuntu right now? It was 2 years ago when I used it. My mothers PC is running on Celeron single core 2.2GHz with 512MB RAM, and Ubuntu ran better than windows xp with all performance settings enabled.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:25, topic:441359"][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=544050.msg3988141#msg3988141 date=1336215617]

Ubuntu is very lightweight and I only recommend it if you don’t do any gaming and/or if you have outdated hardware.
For other reasons, go with windows, some fags actually use Ubuntu so they look bad-ass programmers, makes me laugh every time I see one.

Ubuntu is no where near lightweight…
[/quote]
It is more lightweight than windows. Talking from experience and Ubuntu 9.04.[/quote]

If you consider ubuntu lightweight then what is arch? Based on resource usage while idling, Win7 and Ubuntu 12.04 are almost identical. 9.04 is 3 years old now, and long before Unity came around, I think its time you upgrade.

Read full topic
